text: The Golden Age (2014) is a novel by Australian author Joan London. == Plot summary == Frank and Elsa meet at a rehabilitation clinic in suburban Perth in the early 1950s. Both have been stricken with polio, and Frank is a refugee from Hungary. The novel follows the relationship between Frank and Elsa across the years. == Notes == * Dedication: For my three sisters. == Reviews == * The Monthly"The Golden age by Joan London" by Brenda Walker, The Monthly * Sydney Review of Books"Fully present, utterly connected" by Tegan Bennett Daylight, The Telegraph, 31 October 2014 == Awards and nominations == * 2015 shortlisted the Stella Prize * 2015 shortlisted Miles Franklin Literary Award * 2015 shortlisted Kibble Literary Awards — Nita Kibble Literary Award * 2015 shortlisted ASAL Awards — ALS Gold Medal * 2015 shortlisted Australian Book Industry Awards (ABIA) — Australian Literary Fiction Book of the Year ==References== Category:2014 Australian novels Category:Novels set in the 1950s
title: The Golden Age (London novel)
